item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 9, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenCoder: Open-Source LLM for Coding (129 points | 19 comments)
2. Windows Process Injection (46 points | 5 comments)
3. Jaws – a JavaScript to WASM ahead of time compiler (55 points | 25 comments)
4. There aren't enough smart people in biology doing something boring (34 points | 14 comments)
5. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (272 points | 65 comments)
6. IronCalc – Open-Source Spreadsheet Engine (43 points | 12 comments)
7. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (201 points | 40 comments)
8. Scientist treated her own cancer with viruses she grew in the lab (261 points | 109 comments)
9. Texture-Less Text Rendering (149 points | 42 comments)
10. Automat: A tangible interface for virtual things (9 points | discuss)
11. SVDQuant: 4-Bit Quantization Powers 12B Flux on a 16GB 4090 GPU with 3x Speedup (131 points | 41 comments)
12. Trellis (YC W24) is hiring eng to turn documents into database ( | hide)
13. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (125 points | 63 comments)
14. Memories are not only in the brain, human cell study finds (146 points | 63 comments)
15. The Saturn V FUELDRAULIC Gimbal System (1963) (27 points | 11 comments)
16. HPV vaccination: How the world can eliminate cervical cancer (238 points | 100 comments)
17. Ticketmaster’s attempt to game arbitration services fails (194 points | 45 comments)
18. Calculating at Pencil and Paper Scale (5 points | discuss)
19. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (102 points | 28 comments)
20. Notes on Guyana (80 points | 72 comments)
21. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (257 points | 113 comments)
22. Nikolai Fyodorov wanted to resurrect the dead to live among the stars (37 points | 14 comments)
23. Using Two ReMarkables (68 points | 33 comments)
24. A CC-By Open-Source TTS Model with Voice Cloning (109 points | 21 comments)
25. Delta: A syntax-highlighting pager for Git, diff, grep, and blame output (539 points | 71 comments)
26. Segmenting Credit Card Customers with K-Means: A Fun Dive into Clustering (44 points | 25 comments)
27. Lynis – Security auditing and hardening tool, for Unix-based systems (38 points | 7 comments)
28. Mitochondria Are Alive (593 points | 370 comments)
29. Iterative α-(de)blending and Stochastic Interpolants (18 points | 1 comment)
30. Gravity's Eastern Voyage (33 points | 3 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 9, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
